name: Williamsburg Inn

reviews.text: It was a cold winter getaway when we stayed at this beautiful Inn. It really is first class...services, people, accommodations, amenities, and nearby historic attractions. When we arrived at our spacious, well laid out suite, we asked the front desk to have the “fireman” come, bring some firewood, and light our fireplace. It quickly warmed the room and us. Even though it may not sound like a significant event, it felt so good and relaxing in such a historic setting. The Inn has so much, a spa, a championship “Golden Horseshoe” golf course, and wonderful traditional food. Although British royalty has stayed here, the staff makes you feel like “family” right at the beginning of your stay when Emery, the Doorman, welcomes you. The dining area is well staffed with people like Linda and Nevin who try to make your experience enjoyable with their recommendations. Our “package” included admission tickets for the adjacent historic Williamsburg area. If you have never visited Williamsburg, this is a treat for all, regardless of age. We debated “Richard Henry Lee” and “George Washington” and attended a service at one of the oldest Episcopal churches in US (Burton Parish) where all the Virginia signers of the Declaration of Independence worshiped. The only downside is that is it very expensive. I guess you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Cold But It Will Warm You

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed at the Inn many times over the years, and it is remains our favorite destination- the hotel against which we measure all others. The service is impeccable, the dining superb, the atmosphere classic, charming, and old school. There may be better values in the Williamsburg area, but there is nothing that compares with the experience and setting of the Inn, and it is within easy walking distance of all of Colonial Williamsburg.
reviews.title: First Class

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Inn many times - for Christmas, Thanksgiving, 4th of July - it is always beautiful and consistent. The hotel is beautifully maintained, I have compared many hotels to it over the years. It is charming and quaint and elegant all at the same time. The restaurants are perfect and the Sunday Brunch is the best I have ever had. The proximity of the hotel to the colomial area is excellent. The staff are always happy and accomodating. It is well worth the price.
reviews.title: Always a Joy

reviews.text: You HAVE to stay here! If you like unique, luxury resorts with character... you will love this hotel! The staff knows your name, the hotel stays true to it's historical apperance by offering a traditional bedside clock as an alarm (and there is also the hidden digital alarm as well) and there is a bottle of cold Panna water awaiting your return each evening from your leisurely walks through Colonial Williamsburg. The furnishings are gorgeous and the rooms are huge! I stayed in a room in the front corner, near the entrance. It was the most moderately priced room, but we lucked out. There were a total of 5 (nearly) floor to ceiling windows with 2 more in the bathroom. The bathrooms are huge and luxuriously appointed. You even get to keep the slippers :) It's a wonderful hotel, with so much history. Splurge and skip the colonial homes for that resort experience! I can't wait to go back! Seriously, the nicest place with character that I've stayed at.
reviews.title: I LURV The Inn!

likes.liked: — The character, the old hardware and the luxurious appointments
likes.disliked: — The room service is over priced and mediocre at best. $50 for pecan pie, a cookie and a carafe of hot chocolate is a bit much for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel for a three night anniversary getaway. It was a great choice! The room was very large, and the bathroom featured double bowl sinks, separate shower and soaking tub, tastefully done in marble. Everything was exceptionally clean and the common areas seemed to have undergone a recent upgrade. We really did not need our car to tour Williamsburg, as we could walk or take the bus wherever we needed to go. We had breakfast in the diningroom, but no evening meals. For the $20. price for the breakfast buffet, we felt it should have had an omelet/egg/waffle station, but the selections were adequate. Staff seemed very friendly and accommodating. If we return to Williamsburg, we definitely will stay at this resort again. We had a light supper at the Williamsburg Lodge, but that does not have the same level of service.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel thoroughly deserves its 5 stars. The overall property is superb, well furnished with nice, period style rooms. Great swimming pools (3) and well kept grounds. Staff were universally pleasant and attentive without being overly deferential. We sampled (snack) lunch, dinner and breakfast and all were good. The room was very large and well appointed throughout. To top it off, it is 3 minutes stroll to the historic recreated Williamsburg town centre with its Independence period dressed "interpreters" who are fascinating. One tip, get your tickets at the hotel and get the hotel residents discount.
reviews.title: First class hotel

reviews.text: This is by no means a cheap hotel but it knows what it's worth and charges accordingly.
reviews.title: The highest praise for the hotel, managment and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is what a well run hotel looks like and I will take a few minutes to share my thoughts.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Inn - But Terribly Expensive

reviews.text: From the moment we stepped foot on the Williamsburg Inn property we were greeted in the most welcoming and professional manner. Our two day, one night stay was perfect certainly due to a number of individuals who helped us directly, but what really makes the Williamsburg Inn shine is the very evident pride of stewardship of a storied hotel in a storied location that is obviously shared by everyone who works there. For example, I have no idea who made our meals, but they were beautifully presented and prepared. The public and private rooms were impeccable. The landscaping - the mixture of annuals and perrennials - very well done.
reviews.title: The Place to Stay in Williamsburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now, the best part is the front desk and the restaurant personnel. They are complete professionals and know how to make one's stay memorable and delightful. The know how to take care of people....even 'clients from hell'. While at a meal with my family, there was an absolutely insufferable couple that, from the moment they entered the dining room had a complaint about every single table location and dish that came to their table. Wierd and rude, what a combo. The staff were so responsive and clearly knew that the best way to deal with this type of customer is to play to their personality and move the experience along to a good ending.
reviews.title: Stay Away

reviews.text: Colonial Williamsburg is a real trip to the past. An entertaining, historic trip that will delight both young and old, historical buffs and the historically curious alike. The Inn is charming, beautifully decorated, the rooms are spacious, clean and well appointed. The front desk staff needs training, take a cue from all the reviews here, not everyone can be wrong. The restaurants serve good quality food for a fair price, again, the service is spotty. The food at the taverns, Kings Arms, Christiana Campbell, is better than I expected.
reviews.title: Best way to learn our history
Elegant but pompus and replete with small annoyances
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 days in an elegant and comfy room and delighted in visits to nearby historical sites, but the very high room rate and a multitude of small annoyances make me wish that I had chosen another location, perhaps the lodge or rooms in historic buildings. It was slack season so the place was usually quite empty. Two breakfasts in the beautiful dining room seemed lonely and the elegantly served food ,although quite expensive, was not particularly delicious. We prefered walking to the Lodge for a simpler and tastier breakfast .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was generous, beautifully decorated with wonderful beds. However, the toilet seat cover would not stay up, the bathroom wallpaper was peeling, the floor was frighteningly slippery in sock feet or wet feet, our robes were removed for some reason and had to be re-requested, a TV guide was provided but not an explanation of which stations were which on their old RCA set, playing cards to borrow could not be found after 6 pm when the concierge closes, the turndown service gal never seemed able to wait until we had left for supper at 6 pm to do her job, etc. All small quibbles but at their prices I expected a quibble-free visit.
reviews.title: Beautiful property -- scattered service

likes.disliked: — Rude treatment from room service folks

reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Williamsburg Inn for a long weekend visit to Colonial Williamsburg and Jamestown. We had a wonderful time and loved the Williamsburg Inn.
reviews.title: Stay in a Colonial Home!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is right there in the heart of the living museum that is Colonial Williamsburg. We were a 3-4 minute walk from the colonial street and the exhibits. It was also a 2 minute walk to the spa. It is a beautiful hotel -- built in 1936 -- and decorated in antiques with fires roaring in the lounges. There are multiple lounges, and we had the "East Lounge" all to ourselves each night. There was also a very small lounge with a writing desk that I loved -- it is perfect for writing post cards or writing in a journal.
reviews.title: Beautifull place!!!14 years later...

reviews.text: Our family of 4 (parents and two daughters ages 14 and 11) stayed for two nights in a Resort Suite at the Williamsburg Inn. The room was lovely - furnished with 18th century reproductions and quite spacious. Large living area with queen-sized pull out couch (kids slept here) several chairs and a desk. The bedroom and bathroom are very large (king bed) and nicely appointed.
reviews.title: Lovely southern hospitality

reviews.text: Service was great - there is a lovely snack laid out in the late afternoon and each night there are crystal cookie jars placed in strategic spots in the hallways with nice chocolate chip cookies. In the morning there is free self-serve coffee and tea in the small casual restaurant to the right of the lobby.
reviews.title: Thank goodness we called in !

likes.liked: — Bathroom,boy did I need a soak.
likes.disliked: — The room was quite big so it was a heck of a trail to the bathroom.

reviews.text: Hotel is an easy 5 minute walk to Colonial Williamsburg.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return!

likes.liked: — Superior guest service to coincided with superior accommodations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would easily stay here again.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better

likes.disliked: — comp bathrobes were heavy and scratchy

reviews.text: We very nearly didn't visit Williamsburg,I thought it was going to be too much of a theme park.....fortunately it was late as we arrived in the area and this sounded like the only hotel of interest to stay so we called in on the off chance.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel and friendly helpful staff

description: Gracious Country Estate-style Inn situated in heart of historic district.
